BVoc in Management and Entrepreneurship

What this Blog Includes

  • What is BVoc?
  • Who should do a BVoc in Management and entrepreneurship?
  • Difference between BVoc MEPS( Management and entrepreneurship ) and BBA or B.COM
  • How much demand is there After doing BVoc Management and Entrepreneurship
  • How many types of industries are there in BVoc Management and Entrepreneurship (MEPS).
  • What are the Scopes After doing BVoc in MEPS (Management and entrepreneurship)

What is BVoc?

BVoc or Bachelor of Vocational Education is a non-traditional undergraduate degree offered in various fields for students who want to gain skill-based education. A BVoc course helps students to be industry-ready right after completing the course. To know more click here .

Who should do a BVoc in Management and entrepreneurship?

  • People who are an extrovert
  • Has an outgoing personality
  • Enjoys talking to people
  • Enjoys managing things and takes initiative

  • The students who are actively managing programs of school can do BVoc management and entrepreneurship because there is a lot of scope in management and entrepreneurship and there are many different types of jobs available in this particular field.

Difference between BVoc MEPS( Management and entrepreneurship ) and BBA or B.COM

Now a student is doing BBA marketing and on the other hand a student doing BVoc marketing. Then what will be the difference? The BBA student learns about the market by sitting in a classroom for 3 years while a BVoc student learns marketing in Classroom and in a company.

It might sound funny to hear learn marketing by sitting in a classroom. If you want to learn marketing, you have to do actual marketing, you have to convince someone, explain the product to someone, or if you want to do digital marketing, you have to promote a product on Facebook, Instagram and other platforms. If you are less interested in learning theory and you want to get some practical experience then you can join BVoc and get placed in a retail company for 3 years.

After three years, the student who has completed BBA Marketing will be a fresher while BVoc student will have three years of experience in marketing or management with a bachelor degree. Now BBA students think of doing MBA to get a good job. He studied MBA for 2 years and is still considered a fresher. On the other hand if any Bvoc student do masters in MBA or MVoc then he will have minimum 3-5 years of experience as compared to the student doing BBA.

After 5 years, The BBA student only completed his 3 years in bachelor's and 2 years in master’s, but still he is fresher with a degree. On the other hand a BVoc student will have BVoc + MBA + five years of marketing experience. When both of them appear for an interview for any management position who do you think will get the preference? The one with the experience right! That is why a BVoc degree is way better for management as compared to BBA or BCom.

How much demand is there After doing BVoc Management and Entrepreneurship

We would say that management and entrepreneurship are the most in demand because you cannot imagine running an organization without management. Management is required in every field from Hospital to Education institute to Real Estate.

Political organizations like BJP, Congress or Aam Aadmi Party also need marketing and management to sustain. Whether you are in the education field or the e-commerce field there will always be demand for management people and that is the reason why you should go for a management career.

How many types of industries are there in BVoc Management and Entrepreneurship (MEPS).

  • Retail
  • Real estate
  • Finance and banks
  • Export-import
  • Automobile
  • Telecom
  • Information technology
  • Hotels and restaurants
  • NGOs
  • Religious organizations
  • Political organizations
  • E-commerce companies
  • Education
  • Social media and many others…

What are the Scopes After doing BVoc in MEPS (Management and entrepreneurship)

  • Family business
  • Start-ups and entrepreneurship
  • Government exams like UPSC/GPSC/IBPS and others
  • Sales and marketing
  • Operation management
  • Human resource management
  • Finance and banking
  • Any other field where management is required from tele-caller to CEO
